catalog.title: Info Technology & Mgmt II
catalog.description: Introduces the topics of information systems and information technology from the managerial perspective. The overarching theme of the course is how to use technology to create business value. A wide range of technical topics will be covered within the context of this theme. Students will also be introduced to database software such as Microsoft Access.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Info Technology & Mgmt II

catalog.title: Info Technology & Mgmt II

catalog.title: MIS Internship
catalog.description: Provides students within the management science and systems option with an opportunity to apply classroom theories to real-life situations. Students choose their own placement from a listing available from the Internship Program Office. The placement process is similar to that of a job search. Students have the opportunity to send their resumes to sites of their choosing and interview for placement. Each site assigns a specific project to the student to be completed within 150 hours during the course of the semester. Management science and systems students work under the supervision of a management science and systems professional and receive exposure to the day-to-day operations within a professional setting
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Independent Study
catalog.description: Instructional and practical experience in the skills and techniques of research through association with a faculty member actively engaged in research. Credit up to 6 hours, depending on the type and amount of research activity. May be taken for credit more than once.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Digital Forensics
catalog.description: Introduction to digital forensics.  Students will acquire, authenticate, and analyze digital evidence. We will explore technical and managerial topics, and provide students with both theoretical and practical hands-on experience using forensic equipment and software.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: MGS 351 or MGS 102 and junior or senior standing in the School of Management.
catalog.prerequisites: MGS 351 or MGS 102 and junior or senior standing in the School of Management

catalog.title: Mgmt of IT Projects
catalog.description: MIS concentration capstone course.  Advanced MIS majors, operating as a high performance team, will engage in and complete the design and implementation of a significant information system,  Project management, management of the IS function, and systems integration will be components of the project experience.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and senior standing in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management.
catalog.prerequisites: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and senior standing in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management

catalog.prerequisites: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and senior standing in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management

catalog.title: Tech Consulting for Soc Impact
catalog.description: Students will learn the principles of Technology Consulting while using and implementing modern technologies. They will do so via online learning, in-class presentations, and a client implementation for a local non-profit. By the conclusion of the course, students will experience first-hand, the necessary prerequisites to be successful in the technology consulting industry. This course is dual listed with MGS 686.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Sp Top in Info Systems
catalog.description: Topics vary by semester.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Systems Security
catalog.description: During this introductory course, students will learn fundamental security topics in a hands-on and applied fashion. Students will critically examine concepts such as basic networking, system administration, team dynamics, risk management and system security as well as identify and apply basic security hardening techniques. Students will gain practical experience using a virtualized lab environment where they will build, configure and secure a small corporate network.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Cybersecurity, Privacy & Ethic
catalog.description: This course offers in-depth coverage of the current risks and threats to an organization¿s data, combined with a structured way of addressing the safeguarding of these critical electronic assets. The course provides a foundation for those new to information security as well as those responsible for protecting network services, devices, traffic, and data. Additionally, the course provides the broad-based knowledge necessary to prepare students for further study in other specialized security fields. Students will be trained in the concepts and practices of data privacy and ethical management of sensitive data.  This course is dual-listed with MGS 639.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems

catalog.title: Cybersecurity
catalog.description: Students will learn the present-day terms, philosophies, technologies, and strategies that go into buttressing an organization¿s cybersecurity posture. Managing the resources of a corporate information assurance program, while continually improving a risk footprint and response, is an underpinning of all topics that will be covered. Students will critically examine concepts such as networking, system administration, and system security as well as identifying and applying basic security hardening techniques. Students will gain practical experience through a virtualized lab environment where they will build and secure a small corporate network.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description:
Pre-Requisite: MGS 314 or CSE 115;
BS ITM Program or Cybersecurity Minor students only.
catalog.prerequisites:
MGS 314 or CSE 115;
BS ITM Program or Cybersecurity Minor students only

catalog.title: Systems Anal & Design
catalog.description: Acquaints students with the various concepts and technologies used in the analysis and design of computer-based systems. The course introduces techniques for studying business information flows, defining information requirements, and designing and implementing computer-based solutions. Also surveys modern software development practices and such methods as rapid applications development and prototyping, and the use of automated tools to support software development.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management.
catalog.prerequisites: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management

catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: CSE 113 OR CSE115 OR MGS 314, MGS 102 OR MGS 351, MGS402, MGS 404 OR MGS 613, and in Business Administration or Information Technology and Management.

catalog.title: Big Data Technologies
catalog.description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the big data technologies. The course exposes students to innovative big data products, key players, and the contemporary vendor landscape along with issues involved in transitioning to big data technologies. The course lays special emphasis on NoSQL database technologies such as Key-Value store database, Document oriented database, Graph database, columnar database along with relevant use cases and their relative advantages and disadvantages. Students will receive an in-depth overview of MongoDB, corresponding data models and capabilities.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: MGS 102 and MGS 404 and in Information Technology and Management.
catalog.prerequisites: MGS 102 and MGS 404 and in Information Technology and Management

catalog.title: Intro to Mgmt Info Systms
catalog.description: Introduces the basic concepts of management information systems from the managerial perspective. Topics include systems theory, information theory, systems analysis, and database management. Also introduces computer software, such as Lotus 1-2-3 and Microsoft Access.
catalog.subject: Management Science and Systems
catalog.requisites_description: Pre-Requisite: MGQ 201 and junior standing in the School of Management. Students may not repeat upper-level School of Management courses in which they have earned passing grades in without consulting with an academic advisor.
